Ice::

She looked into Veratis mind and saw the eventually, according to the 
beliefs of the prophecy, the maximals and predacons as they knew them 
now would go exinct. The new mutants would rise above the current 
bots and take over. That didn't mean the end of the war. It  just 
meant the the end of the current bots as they  knew it.

(OK, how 's that for a really close guess?)

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> OOCThat depends on what you think Veratis would say. Your 
characters the
> mind reader, you tell me what I'm thinking and I'll let you know if 
you're
> right.
> 
> 
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: <logomorph@h...>
> To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
> Sent: Monday, November 27, 2000 6:41 AM
> Subject: Re: Class is in session
> 
> 
> > Ice::
> >
> > She looked at Lunarpine, then to Razor Claw. She sighed. There 
were
> > jsut the tree of them. She turned to Veratis."Uh, what will 
happen to
> > the bots that currently exist? I mean, will the maximals and
> > predacons simply, er, go exstinct?" She had left friends behind in
> > the maximal camps. She still had hopes of seeing them again, 
someday.
> >
> > She looked down at her clips board and at her notes from the 
class.
> > She was hoping that Veratis wouldn't say what she thought he would
> > say. She kept her mind closed and waited to hear the answer.
> >
> >
> > --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > > Veratis turned and hesitated for a moment before
> > answering, "Whatever the
> > > matrix has in store for you is what happens."
> > >
> > > Lunarpine wasn't convinced, "And what will happen to the bots 
that
> > don't
> > > change?" he asked in a pessamistic tone.
> > >
> > > "They will either join us and become what we are or perish in 
the
> > > transition. Veratis had the same determined look on his face 
like
> > when he'd
> > > told Lunarpine about the prophecy of Prime the first time.
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
